Reviews.Title: “hotel turvan”
Reviews.Author: cuppachai
Reviews.Content: i stayed here 6 nights. the receptionist at first welcomed us and gave us an okayish room - (interconnecting family room) - we went site seeing and they came inside the room to check everything - made me feel slightly uncomfortable - after they received our payment, they dint bother welcoming us - until the last day the receptionist reminded us that we would have to write a review from the agency we booked through and please write something nice. oh yeah, when booking it said the hotel offers free sauna jacuzzi turkish bath - its not free and you have to pay for it - so we were deceived. the bedding wasnt changed regularly - and the beds are not made as clean - lifts are a bit tacky, but fast. breakfast was not so good - you have alot of dips, sauces. once breakfast finishes they dont top up - so you need to go for it as quickly as possible the nightime receptionist khadija is very nice - hospitable and caring. the location of teh hotel is ideal - opposite is an xcellent eating place - very friendly and they speak good english. bathroom is clean - though one morning there was no hot water, we had to go and tell receptionist several times before the hot water came

Reviews.Title: “Turvan is my home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Margele-Mariashop-ro
Reviews.Content: A great place that I love. 5 years go to Istanbul, but the first time I went to Turvan two years ago. Then I returned again and again only Turvan. There is not a new or modern hotel, but the staff is very friendly, the place is very intimate and the breakfast is very diversified. Train station, tram station and port passenger ships is at 2-5 minutes walking. Because Turvan is located in a street where cars do not move, which is full of restaurants, in the night is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “my (3rd) stay at the Turvan.”
Reviews.Author: davut2
Reviews.Content: I got back from Istanbul just 5 days ago.I stayed at the Turvan Hotel for the 3rd time in the last year (which speaks for itself !).A great value hotel ideally located between the bosphorus docks & the Blue Mosque area.the staff here are so friendly,I am always made to feel so welcome.they are so helpful if you need any local transport etc.(the nearest tram station is just 3 minutes walk away).rooms cleaned regularly. Also great choice at breakfast I will be back again in May If you are looking for good value,clean comfortable accomodation in the heart of Istanbul, then this is the place for you.Highly recommended.David. UK

Reviews.Title: “dirty...”
Reviews.Author: Vezunchik
Reviews.Content: My impression of Istanbul was spoiled by this hotel... It seems they don't even have a vacuum cleaner! When I arrived to my room I found mold on shower walls, dirty mirror and carpeting and no toilet paper. I felt disgusted... had to find the toilet paper myself, by looking into the cleaner's rooms, because the reception did not do anything about my phone call. The bathroom door lock did not work and the breakfast did not offer much to eat. On the positive side, the staff were friendly, the location was good, and we paid just 40 eur per night in November, but I would not recommend this hotel until they learn to clean and renovate the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Turvan Hotel Istanbul Turkey”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne N
Reviews.Content: There is a HAVAS bus from Sabiha Gokcen Airport to Taksim. In Taksim you can take Finikuler to Kabatas , In Kabatas take Tramway to Sirkeci. We are just a few minutes walk from Sirkeci Tramway station. These directions led me to the nicest experience possible in the ancient city of Istanbul. Ferhat greeted me like a family member, 'We've been waiting for you Miss Suzanne". Ten days with this compassionate family hotel environment opened the soul of Turkey right before my eyes. All the staff were helpful (a special mention for Emre and Havva) and home prepared meals delicious. I'm from Australia but I was referred to this hotel by a traveller from Mexico so the good word is really spreading for 'Otel Turvan' in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “~1 week stay at Turvan Hotel (Istanbul) 17th of Sept. 2011”
Reviews.Author: Jens W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Turvan from 17th to 27th of September, and I'm definitely completely satisfied. So, what do you have to expect from a Hotel in Istanbul to set your expectations correctly? I will list some categories that seem to be important for me and that the reader can also understand why I would definitely recommend to stay there: 1. VALUE for money: +++ outstanding (difficult to find another hotel with so many advantages for that money) 2. FRIENDLINESS of hotel staff and RELIABILITY of recommendations: +++ outstanding 3. SAFETY (location): ++ very good (it's not a bunker, but there is a police station in walking distance) 4. ROOM QUALITY: + good (you simply must cut back expactions a little bit when you stay in Turkey or you must chose a hotel where you have to pay the same what you have to pay in western European countries, which I would say starts at 120,-â‚¬/night which is more than twice of what you pay at the Turvan; I already stayed at several hotels like NH or Radisson in different European countries and I will still recommend the Turvan, because everything is either there what you need - although sometimes with little flaws - or they will arrange something for you) 5. BOOKING: +++ outstanding (very good internet site in multiple languages where you can see 360 degree pics of the hotel (inside and outside) 6. PICK UP SERVICE from/to the airport: +++ outstanding (If you are for the first time in Turkey don't let you fool by some of the Taxi drivers, I would really recommend that you use the pick up service and this person will take care of you and bring you safely to the hotel. Most Taxi drivers will not speak English or German, so I would not recommend to take a Taxi unless you're able to speak Turkish, at least not when you just arrived in Istanbul for the first time like me. See also www.turkeytravelplanner.com) 7. MISCELLANIOUS: good breakfast; they have a traditional Turkish bath ("Hamam") and a Sauna; the cleaning stuff fills up everything if it's empty; placed in street with nice restaurants; only 5-10 minutes by foot to reach the ferryboat docking stations to KadikÃ¶y and ÃœskÃ¼dar; very good "strategical" place to start sightseeing trips; vivid place, so there are many tourists in the district of EminÃ¶nÃ¼ and you can feel safe; the hotel staff can help to organize sightseeing tours or there is also an agency directly in EminÃ¶nÃ¼ that is recommended by www.turkeytravelplanner.com) Overall it's a good place to stay. Try it! You will see that you won't regret it, and you will get in touch with very nice people inside and also outside of the hotel and get to know a little bit of the culture of this wonderful place called Istanbul :-) You can visit their homepage here: www.turvan.com

Reviews.Title: “gr8 hotel and will be goin back!”
Reviews.Author: chantelle123
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotle in aug 4 6 nights and was a bit worried about staying here due 2 the bad reveiws! the staff was extreamly helpful and very kind.....the bedrroms and bathroom was a good size to! the maids cleaned our room every day and changed our lining and towles 4 times!!! and the location was briliant there is a restrant as soon as u step outside of the hotle that every one should try was lovely food and very friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Took a MASSIVE Gamble..Loved my stay and would comeback!!”
Reviews.Author: Mikeymate
Reviews.Content: To be honest I had second and third thoughts and was going to cancel before I arrived into Istanbul what with all of the negative reviews..I am so very very glad I didn't!! I gave it a whirl and headed straight onto the Metro and Tram for the City. The location was an easy one to find by foot (5 minute walk from tram stop), so central and a stone throw away from the infamous Galetta Bridge and main line train station. The staff were welcoming and friendly enough, although one youngish odd looking Reception man on check-in was staring at me relentlessly as well as the bellboy, I felt a little intimidated by this. My room smelt of smoke and felt dusty, with odd bits of carpet stuck to the skirting boards - very strange. Yes, there are a few bare wires poking out of the corridor, but pretty high so nobody can reach. I slept extremely well and the linen was clean and crisp. Tv has many turkish and Arab channels, but I had no time for Tv as I was in an exciting city! Breakfast was plentiful and very tasty - lots to choose from! I left my luggage until the afternoon, no problems. Although the hotel felt a little rundown and very much a jump into the early 1980's, I loved it and it is all about the location. I was never hassled and felt extremely safe. No bed bugs were fround whatsover! Thank you Turvan Hotel, I am glad I stayed!

Reviews.Title: “THIEVES!!!!!!!!!! the cleaning lady took her tip herself 100$!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ver0nkaF
Reviews.Content: The location is good and that's the only thing i realy like about this hotel. I'm very disappointed. I am very understanding, i didn't complain about leaking ceiling and fungus in the bathroom but when one day someone called from the reception and told me that i need to pack in 10 minutes because they need my room and they will give me another one from the afternoon i was pissed( i don't know what would they do if i was not in the room at that time), but that was nothing: while i was packing i discovered my small purse( i use it only on airports i had few euro coins and a hundred dollar bill in it i put it in my hand luggage suitcase) stuffed under the bed with a HUNDRED DOLLARS MISSING!!!!!!!! The hotel management did nothing about it. I wish i could have enough time and patience to demand some kind of compensation :(

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: loco4mango
Reviews.Content: Words cannot express the anxiety this hotel caused me and my tour group. I woke up with dead bed bugs and dried blood on my pillowcase and bedsheets. You have no idea what kind of trauma this can cause - specially when you're on holiday. These bites surfaced more and more as the days went by. Besides the bug incident, I was given keys to my floor (4th floor) and was dismayed when I saw construction. So beside it being noisy, I didn't even need a key to open my room. I didn't have a door knob. Besides this "issue", people complained of broken items in their rooms such as toilet seats, dirty showers, molds to name a few. Even the toilet in their main floor was stinky and dirty. To find this hotel is like being on a treasure hunt. My cab driver didn't even know how to get there. Despite the fact that it's in a fairly good location - there are other hotels that are in better shape than this one. I would not recommend this place to anyone at all - this is a HOTEL NIGHTMARE. If you opt to stay at this place - don't forget your plastic bags. Let's hope you won't have to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty”
Reviews.Author: SarahS196
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be shut down. Bathroom was dirty, toilet did not quite work, pigeon poo all over window sill. Staff came into my room twice while I was in the bathroom. Road work outside left a 2 ft ditch that I had to jump over to get inside. Really, really gross.

Reviews.Title: “Best buy”
Reviews.Author: mtdmg
Reviews.Content: Returned to Turvan after 3 years just for couple of days - still very inexpensive BUT much nice after rennovation with GREAT breakfast choices. We were kindly offered family room for the same price as double-bed room. Nice people, nice place in Cirkechi.

Reviews.Title: “Do not choose this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: souchkoff
Reviews.Content: Rooms are dirty and extremely small, smaller than they appear on photos. Value for money is awful. Next day after we arrived we have decided to leave. Manager didn't want to check us out. He wanted to charge the full price of booking â€“ 4 nights. That was very rude.

Reviews.Title: “call this a hotel?”
Reviews.Author: geminiBeograd
Reviews.Content: we were back from a divine turkish coast family holiday traveling with our own car. Decided to see Istanbul so we booked Turvan so called hotel over internet for two nights.Being in the location in the very center of the old part of town we knew it would be a little tacky to find a car parking, but we did.Entering Turvan we still did not have a single clue what awaits us in rooms.I assumed it was logical that the hotel cant be spacious because of the close tight packed houses in the area and I had no problem with that.But the lobby is where civilisation ends in this hotel. Our two teenage sons had their room one floor up above our room.The moment I entered our room I got a moldy aroma knock out in the face. The room is very small. but thats not nearly anything in comparison to the rest. The covers are suspicious, one of them dirty, the curtains dirty and dusty, the electricity socket for tv dangling. the fridge door with the water in it, dirty. When I stepped into the bathroom I almost collapsed, the air was nowhere - it was mold, mold and mold in 100% concentration. The water handle for the toilette was broke and connected with a wire to the watering mechanism. The electricity socket pulled out of the wall clinging with some wires that could be seen. the glass shelf on the wall above the bassin dirty, and finally the bath tub damaged and dirty, the edge around it slimy and moldy and dirty, the bathtub cabin door dirty and moldy. Couple of minutes later there was an electricity black out problem in our and some other rooms, which the lobby man jumbled out with the safety fuses, only that after twenty minutes later the same problem occured again. By that time I was furious and desperate and on the edge of an allergic seizure due to mold. We decided to sleep in that night but to leave tomorrow. We couldnt find vacant rooms anywhere around in hotels in the vicinity although there was a lot of them and they mostly looked fair enough, paradise compare to Turvan. We didnt want to eat breakfast in there tomorrow morning, but just out of curiousity I went to see the dining area. It looked like it was decent , up to the point when I raised my head and saw that a part of the ceiling around the ventilation , just above one of the dining tables was torn off due to water flooding on the above floor. Dirt and parts of the ceiling composition was hanging high up over peoples heads and one that didnt look could easily sit under that and have the parts of THAT fall into his plate and food.Luckily there were some wonderful bakeries with lots of great pastry and coffees in the proximity, so we went out there, sat and had civilized breakfast. The Topkapi and the Agia Sofia are very close by, so we went to see the places, had lunch after that and unfortunately started off back home, since we had nowhere to spend the other night, and we didnt want to do that in Turvan. They didnt want to give our money back, so practicaly, we payed for two nights while staying only one night in there. And maybe thats how they rip off people, a very (un)subtle way to rob tourists. I dont require luxury, I do very well with tight places, but its the dirt and the collapsing building of Turvan that simply made the last drop in a full glass. Ill remember the horror of the bathrooms for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel, this one is awful”
Reviews.Author: LarsStockholmSweden
Reviews.Content: Extremely poor standard for a 3-star hotel (lower than all hostels we stayed at in Turkey). We stayed in double room 105 and it was NOT worth â‚¬50/night. Painting of walls in the bedroom was not finished, no electricity in the bathroom (hence, the hairdryer didn't work), toilet not fixed to the floor, very poor cleaning with hair on the floor and the bathroom is generally filthy, bed sheets not intended for double bed which tore the sheets from the bed once you turned in bed, lamps were only fluorescent light in the entire room (which is not very pleasant) but fortunately they didn't work and were not changed (despite complaining twice over the course of 6 days). I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wretched Hotel With Possible Fraud!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AbbyGriff
Reviews.Content: This hotel is incredibly dirty and borders on squalid. We weren't as upset with this, however, as we were when faulty purchases popped up on my husband's debit card a few days after we got back. The ONLY placed we paid with card on our trip was at the hotel, so I'm left to believe that the hotel is at fault.

Reviews.Title: “Bad choice.”
Reviews.Author: raynea
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 4 nights in March for 29E/nt. My single room had 2 single (smaller than twin) beds in a very small space, a mini fridge(bar). with a 13"TV sitting on it and a stool and mirror. There was no deadbolt or lock on the inside of the door. Because of this I asked for a different room, but was told that non had interior locks. The bathroom and in particular the shower was GROSS. The grout and cault were moldy, the tub was either stained or filthy or both. In the room none of the electrical outlets were attached flush (properly) with the wall, but were dangling. For breakfast there was a table with lots of stuff, but almost nothing that looked edible. There was cereal but no milk or yogurt to eat with it. There is a hammam here, but they charge 25E for it. The next day I booked a beautiful hotel around the corner, Ipak Palas Hotel, for 1E more a night!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: farzaneh59
Reviews.Content: So close to everything you need, and want to see, , although rooms are small but very clean ,it makes up for the hospitality of every one working there. Friendly , helpful . .Thank you Farhad and Amir, looking forward to seeing you in summer. Mr and Mrs Sims uk

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear...”
Reviews.Author: gweichink
Reviews.Content: Not recommended. The location is good but that is it. Poor rooms, toilet not working and so noisy on the first floor. I felt I like I was sleeping on the pavement.

Reviews.Title: “Quite acceptable; good value; very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: cforbes
Reviews.Content: We'd read both "best" and "worst" in these reviews, so we arrived not knowing what to expect. We were delighted. Very reasonable price. Decent room. Better breakfast than we had gotten elsewhere--though they nickel-dimed you to tea. Very helpful manager who spoke acceptable English (which we found difficult to find in Turkey). Convenient to the Metro, and restaurants. We'd go back if we visited Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Run ... Run ... worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Ciprian-Gabriel
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel ever. A lot of dust, the rooms are not clean, the baths are not working, I have changed rooms twice .... the same effect. In the morning you have to weak up very early if you want to get some food. the breakfast is very poor and the aliments are not fresh with bad quality. I do not recommend this hotel. disavantages: - no parking; - bad rooms, smalls; - bathroom not working; - bad brakfast; - the staff is not sincere and every time want to trick you; - never buy trips from them, you will find cheaper; - dust everywhere, insects; Advantage: - near the Sultan's castle.

Reviews.Title: “words escape me”
Reviews.Author: westie
Reviews.Content: when i arrived with my grandaughter we had to walk the plank as the road was dug up no one from hotle came to help us with baggage they stood looking at us struggle. when we where shown to our room i was shocked it was dirty and not like what was advertised online mini fridge did not work the bathroom was as wet room i ask to see another room i saw 5 in all hotel manager said that hotel was getting a few renovations. when i asked where the room shown in the internet he just shrugged his shoulders and said it was occupied. we left and looked for another

Reviews.Title: “overrated, needs lot of maintenance”
Reviews.Author: billyisourcat
Reviews.Content: At arrival it turned out to be overbooked. They said is was the result of a flooding on the fifh floor. We were taken, after an hour waiting, to a 1 star hotel in the Aksaray neighbourhood. After a three nights stay overthere they ordered us to stay the last night in their hotel. The room was small, The toilet didn't work, no light in the hall so we had to find the keyhole in the dark, after showering you could take an bath in the remaining water (no wonder they had problems with water on the fifth floor). A wonderfull view out of the window in a air-shaft with air-conditioner-units. Breakfast was good. Opposite of local, but cheap restaurants. Hotel has to be redone to earn three stars. Maintenance is poor.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster called Turvan”
Reviews.Author: lunkic
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I saw photos and reviews of Turvan hotel on the Internet, it seemed ok, so we booked it for our trip to Istanbul in December 2008. The same moment we went in our room, we could tell we 'd made a huge mistake. Dust was everywhere like nobody had been cleaning the place for centuries, TV set with two chanels,a fridge that doesn't work, curtains so dirty that you can't make yourself to touch them, the room so small that there is no place for anything except you( even not for your suitcases) and the bathroom....I still have nausea when I remember it..hair in the sink,someone's urine in the toilet...complete disaster.We didn't want to even think about sleeping in that terrible place, so we went out and found another hotel nearby,which was decent,clean and much cheaper! However, when we returned to Turvan and told them we were going to leave,the problems appeared.Hotel managers didn't want to give us our passports because they thought we should have paid for all nine nights although we had no intention to stay there another minute longer. We offered to pay for one night, but they weren't satisfied with it and started yelling at us how we made problems for them by booking the hotel for nine nights and making the cancellation(?!)They didn't even care when I said I was afraid my asthma would worsen if stayed in that room. We couldn't believe what was happening!!! In the end, after 2 hours of argument we paid for two nights and went to our new hotel. I wouldn't recommend Turvan to anyone in the world. Thanks to its managers who act like complete savages Turvan is an offense to modern world and civilisation. Don't let such an experience to ruin your time in magnificent Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel needs a major makeover”
Reviews.Author: sovta
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on moderate price and good location. Upon arrival we were shown to our small rooms. We had requested a crib for our 8 month old but were told there was none available. I'm not sure where we would have put it anyway. The hotel was a disaster and certainly not worth any amount of money. On the third day of our stay we returned to our room to find a person working in the bathroom. We were told that the toilet had leaked flooding the room below. We were asked to keep the water supply valve shut until such time as we needed it. We complied. The next evening we used the bathtub which did not drain properly causing the waste water to flood the bathroom floor. We tried to call the front desk but the phone did not work. I went to the front desk and the manager sent someone to check the problem. We were told that it could not be repaired that evening. I again went to the front desk and requested both a working phone, because we needed an early morning wake up call, and that the bathroom floor be cleaned. The manager would not give us a phone nor would he send anyone to mop the bathroom floor. We used all the towels to dry the floor and deposited them outside our room where they remained through the night. On check out due to our confusion re: currency conversion management knowingly overcharged us $24. They did nothing to rectify the error. The very real problems we encountered and the non service management style negated the fact that the beds were clean and the wait staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “building site”
Reviews.Author: BONNIE1952
Reviews.Content: turvan should not be called a hotel i had to walk the plank across a ditch to get in. when showed my room i justed looked and aked about the room that was showed on the internet. there was no tv the fridge didnt work and i cant describe the bathroom. i asked for another room i was shown 3 others all in a different state of repair. the last one i couldnt even lock the door as they had taken the facings off the door. i went walk about in the sultanhmet and found another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: stoor79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after leaving another hotel. Had a great experience. The staff was great, great location (less than 10 minute walk from aya sofia, blue mosque, seacoast, and other attractions). Close to the metro line too. The breakfast was very good and lots of selections of meats, cheeses, spreads, jams, breads, etc. More than enough before starting out into Istanbul for the day. Rooms were air conditioned and very clean, had no problems. Had a great experience and would (and will) book this hotel again. Thanks Hotel Turvan and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Basic Three Star”
Reviews.Author: alzadjalia
Reviews.Content: This is your basic three star hotel. The hotel reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was very basic and clean with a small TV and empty fridge. The sheets weren't changed during our stay. The bathroom was small but provided for the basic needs. We found that it could have been better cleaned with a bit more effort. We struggled with the hotel to get toilet paper and it took them a long time to provide us with any everytime we asked for it (every night). The towels in the bathroom were not very clean and we had to request them to provide clean towels. Good breakfast with a slection of cheeses, spreads and great olives. Very central location in Sultanahmet close to all the major attractions and the tram and ferry stations. Numerous kebab shops and eateries nearby. An excellent sweet shops (baklavari) just around the corner. Overall we enjoyed our stay and got what we had expected for the cheap price we have paid for the room.
